Now, I’m no expert, but I’m pretty sure you need more than just Ninja Tabi to not be bursted by current Rengar. Doesn’t help that his burst is insane to begin with, but, let’s be real, any champ needs more than a Ninja Tabi when it comes to assassins.

But..that’s also only one instance of a character.

> Entertain me. Wuat other change is good? The fact his E will have even HIGHER CD than he currently has right now?

Well, his E was actually a lower CD compared to live until rank 3, which is an early buff, especially since he doesn’t max it first. A perk will be that as he does level it, the heal percentage was actually buffed.

But, you can be happy cause everything on PBE for him was reverted back to live. It was all experimental. I’d like to see it come back, but that’s me. I saw it as a good change, especially given his kit’s focus on his Q, and granted more uses of Umbral Dash during the ult. It encouraged being used more offensively, for a champ that’s currently an odd juggernaut-diver mix, and rewarded getting good hits by making Blood Well fill by what your heal values. The change also gave some benefit if you get a good ult, some good early hits, but the enemy still disengages from you, since even if they don’t hit you with lethal damage, you will heal.

There were good changes. Perhaps Repertoir wasn’t too satisfied with them, or they want to do some extra tuning.

But at least they aren’t forgetting about him after all the hits they gave him.

So, two lower armor items with no health, a lifeline passive, a GA, and the Blood Well from ult is nothing to a Rengar? But again, that’s a Rengar specific issue, and he needs work done on him.

Aatrox doesn’t really *need* the lethality. He can use it well, and it’s handy, but it’s not a necessity. I’ve seen Cleaver built more often than Lethality on him. I have a feeling Ghostblade’s biggest perk to him is the AD and the active.

Say the main core are DD for the AD and healing, GA for the classic revive, and either Cleaver or Sterak’s (not both here). That leaves two slots, could go for health/resist items, maybe a Spirit Visage to augment healing and for Magic damage, and maybe either a Dead Man’s Plate or Randuin’s for more armor and to cut kiting. If Sterak’s Gage is necessary on top of Cleaver, my gut instinct would be to swap out the DMP/Randuin’s, since the reduction wouldn’t feel as bad with GA and probably Tabi (match dependent) as compared to losing the MR.

Granted, that is theoretical and experimental, though sounds like it could be useful and might give it a try now. Death’s Dance rush can be handy depending on matchup.

So, I have been working on playing him, and trying different things. His Q has high damage, and when the changes were proposed for PBE, it would’ve had no CD and could dish out continuous damage. I couldn’t test it, but decided to theorize and test with what I could. I had one match where the only AD item I built early on was a Death’s Dance, then a Dead Man’s and Spirit Visage, and still dealt good damage, not to mention healing a lot more. Granted, mileage may vary based on matchup and rank, but he still felt like he dealt good damage, especially in a meta where people just don’t build much defense.

> What else you gonna say? Tell an AD to build njnja tabi and randuins?

I’m honestly not sure what point you are trying to make here. Many ADs build Ninja Tabi if necessary, and Randuin’s is a good situational buy on champs that need the defense, particularly bulky builds like for tanks, Juggernauts, and some divers. The health and armor is nice, the Attack Speed slow is handy against ADCs, the slow active helps you stick to champs, and then reduction of crit damage. It’s a solid buy for a champ that may want defensive items. I would absolutely suggest defensive items to champions, especially one that helps them stay with their target.

Old Aatrox only became busted because the meta shifted around him and happened to favor him heavily. When New Aatrox hit the scene his Q damage was simply too high. All they had to do to tweak him and balance him was reduce the damage on that Q and leave everything else alone. Champions having mobility is clearly not an issue with Riot or less champions would have it. 

People raged at Newtrox without thinking about what he had that was so OP. He was designed to fall off in the late game, but dominate early, and that's exactly what he did, but way too well. He was able to dominate early because of the insane damage on his Q, especially early. From what I recall it scaled pretty hard with modest AD as well. This allowed his E healing to leech off minions and monsters and he was oppressive. 



What's the correct balance decision there?

To a sane person you'd simply reduce the scaling on his Q and try it out. Make him have to work harder for that early game advantage he NEEDS to claim to shut down his lane opponent. Still a bit too strong? Reduce the healing on his E by a couple percent. Make it so he can't just Q you and a chunk of your hp bar is gone. Make him have to commit to an assault or think twice.

This is what Riot SAID they wanted to do, and they succeeded, just they as usual went too far and now he's fucking garbage. To them the "correct" balancing move was removing his mobility, his damage, and his healing while also reducing his bases across the board... what. the fuck.

There was no compensation or reasoning beyond "We want Aatrox to not be played for awhile". They flat out said on twitter this was the intent. This just leads me to believe they are incompetent more than I already did. 

Pros picking him up is one thing, they are truly good players with team coordination. If people would REALLY look at pro play Aatrox games right now they'd be able to see how useless he is in team fights. If enemy teams were smart they'd fucking ignore Aatrox and instead they cower at a champion that can't take even one of them past lane phase... it's sad. Nobody wants to acknowledge the evidence right in front of them and they say "Aatrox is fiiiiine". Cept he's not.
